body: Three points are a must for Newcastle to stay ahead in the race to avoid relegation. Rafael Benítez has provided United with a new-found confidence and, unbeaten in four, they should really have the measure of a Villa side whose embarrassing run of defeats now stands at 11. While they scored twice in their past two games, a shambolic defence has shipped four and three in the process. Alan Smith Kick-off Saturday 3pm  Venue Villa Park Last season Aston Villa 0 Newcastle United 0 Referee Robert Madley This season G24, Y64, R5, 3.08 cards per game Odds H 5-1 A 4-7 D 3-1 Aston Villa Subs from Bunn, Toner, Kinsella, Sánchez, Lyden, Agbonlahor, Gil, Grealish, Sinclair, Traoré, Kozak Doubtful Agbonlahor (match fitness), Gestede (groin), Veretout (pelvis) Injured Richardson (calf, 15 May), Amavi (knee, unknown) Suspended Cissokho (one match), Okore (club sanction) Form LLLLLL Discipline Y74 R3 Leading scorer Ayew 7 Newcastle United Subs from Woodman, Janmaat, Taylor, Mbabu, Aarons, Shelvey, Mitrovic, Saivet, De Jong, Pérez, Rivière Doubtful None Injured Elliot (knee, Aug), Haïdara (knee, Aug), Krul (knee, Aug), Coloccini (calf, unknown) Suspended None Form LLWDDW Discipline Y59 R4 Leading scorer Wijnaldum 9
webTitle: Aston Villa v Newcastle United: match preview
